Control::ComponentIterator

Detailed Description

Allows to iterate over all components embedded into a control. Sample code: 
for (Control::ComponentIterator it(control); it.Get() != 0; ++it) {
    Component* comp = it.Get();
    // ...
}

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Control::ComponentIterator::Type
 

Specifies the kind of components which should be iterated.

Enumerator:
All  All drawable objects and controls are iterated (= default value).
Controls  Only controls are iterated.
DrawableObjects  Only drawable objects are iterated.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN Control::ComponentIterator::Begin (   ) 
 

Resets the iterator the the first component. Returns TRUE if the control contains at least one component.

Component* Control::ComponentIterator::Get (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the current component of the iterator.

BOOLEAN Control::ComponentIterator::Next (   ) 
 

Returns TRUE if the controls has a next component. ComponentIterator::Get returns this component.

Control::ComponentIterator Control::ComponentIterator::operator++ (  INT   ) 
 

Moves the iterator to the next component.

Control::ComponentIterator & Control::ComponentIterator::operator++ (   ) 
 

Moves the iterator to the next component.
